intro: Calliandra callistemon, commonly known as the pink calliandra, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its showy, clustered pink or red flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain seeds. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant blooms and ability to thrive in warm climates. Calliandra callistemon also has nitrogen-fixing capabilities, making it beneficial for soil enrichment.
